resource.name: Permitted Septic Systems
resource.description: A listing of permits for the installation of small (individual structure) and large (multi-structure) septic systems.  This dataset includes information such as location (tax parcel), size and capacity, date, and permit number.
resource.attribution: Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control, Division of Water
columns_description: Use of property for which the septic permit is issued.
Groundwater percolation rate. In minutes per inch
Approved system flow rate, in gallons per day.
Proposed size of the septic system, in square feet.
Minimum size of the septic system, in square feet.
Date septic system permit approved.
Date septic system application received.
Date septic system denied.
Date septic permit expired.
Date construction report received.
Permit number of the septic system that is the subject of this record.
County tax parcel identification number for the property on which the septic system is located.
County in which the septic system is located.
Latitude of either the tax parcel or the septic system.
Latitude and Longitude together for mapping purposes.  This is the location of either the tax parcel or the septic system.
Web page link to see more details about the specific septic permit.
Type of septic system technology used.
Type of pretreatment used in system.
Longitude of either the tax parcel or the septic system.
Cartesian X coordinate of either the tax parcel or the septic system.
Cartesian Y coordinate of either the tax parcel or the septic system.
Type of septic system permitted.
Subtype of septic system permitted.
Name of the owner of the property for which the septic system is permitted.
Date septic system abandoned.
Date permit application withdrawn.
Name of the person who designed the septic system.
License number of the person who designed the septic system.
Name of the licensee who installed the septic system.
License number of the licensee who installed the septic system.
Status of the septic system permit.
Type of system construction (new, repair, replacement, etc.).
Code denoting whether the system is a Bed (B) or Trench (T) system.
Additional information about the property for which the septic permit is issued.

resource.name: Well Permits
resource.description: A listing of permits for water wells. The dataset includes information such as location (tax parcel), capacity, date and permit number. Specific location data, for some well types, is redacted per state law.
resource.attribution: Department of Natural Resources and Environmental Control, Division of Water
columns_description: Has well been sampled? (Yes/No)
Does well require a water allocation review? (Required for greater than 50,000 gallons per day) (Yes/No)
Is well in an established Groundwater Management Zone (GMZ)? (Yes/No)
Is well a temporary test well? (Yes/No)
County of well location (New Castle, Kent, Sussex)
The material that makes up the inner casing.
Type of upper terminus unit used to connect well to water distribution system (See attached data dictionary for valid values)

Web page link to see more details about the specific well permit, including scanned documents, if available. [Note: per 29 Del. Code §10002 (l)(17)a.2., specific location information for the following well types has been redacted: Public-Standard, Public-Miscellaneous, Industrial, Fire Protection-Standard, Fire Protection-Public, and Aquifer Storage and Recovery (ASR).]
Is property covered by a Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity (CPCN) issued by the Public Services Commission? (Yes/No)
Is well on a small lot (<0.5 acres)? (Yes/No)
Watershed in which well is located (See attached data dictionary for valid values)
Name of contractor or business installing the well.
Date on which water level was measured.
Depth to maximum water level during pumping, measured in feet below land surface.
Feet below ground surface of the base of the inner casing material.
Feet above or below ground surface of the top of the inner casing material.
Date of well abandonment report for sealed wells, if received..
Date of permit approval.
Date that proposed location was reviewed for potential contaminants.
Date well application was received by DNREC.
Estimated date of construction.
Method used to determine location of well specified in the X, Y, or Lat/Long fields  (See attached data dictionary for valid values).
Latitude of well location in Decimal Degrees (WGS 84).
Hours that the well was tested.
Feet below land surface at which the well pump takes in water.
Feet below ground surface of the top of the gravel filter pack.
Feet below ground surface of the base of the material used to seal the annular space of the well. (The space between the well casing and the ground)
Inches below ground surface of the top of the material used to seal the annular space of the well. (The space between the well casing and the ground)
Feet below land surface of the top of the well screen.
Measurement, in inches, of the top of the well, whether above (+) or below (-) grade.
Maximum diameter of well, in inches.
Estimated daily use of water from the well measured in gallons per day.
Estimated maximum capacity of the well, measured in gallons per minute.
Proposed total depth of well, measured in feet below land surface.
Date of completion report, if received.

County tax parcel identification number for property on which the well is located. Example Parcel ID Format:      New Castle: 07-008.00-033, Kent: MN-00-159.00-01-32.03.000, Sussex: 1-31-02.00-0039.01
Type of well permitted. (See attached data dictionary for valid values)
Easting (X) map coordinate of well location, in Delaware State Plane Coordinate NAD 1983 Meters.
General comments on this record generated during processing and review.
Reason well was abandoned and sealed (e.g. no water, contamination, etc), if known.
Tested capacity of pump, measured in gallons per minute.
License number of contractor or business installing the well.
Material used to seal the annular of the well. (The space between the well casing and the ground) (See attached data dictionary for valid values)
Owner of the well.
Is property covered by a Certificate of Public Convenience and Necessity (CPCN) issued by the Public Services Commission? (Yes/No)
Longitude of well location in Decimal Degrees (WGS 84).
If a replacement well, permit number of the well that was replaced, if known.
Permit number of any septic system on the same property, if available.
Feet below land surface of the bottom of the well screen.
Unique identifier number of the well permit for this record and shown on well tag.
Northing (Y) map coordinate of well location, in Delaware State Plane Coordinate NAD 1983 Meters.
Authorization code for well-drilling activity to create the permitted well.
Rated capacity of pump, measured in gallons per minute.
Actual depth well drilled to, measured in feet below land surface.
Date that the proposed construction specifications were reviewed.

Full address of the owner of the well. Per 29 Del. Code, §10002 (l)(17)a.2., specific location information for the following well types has been redacted: Public-Standard, Public-Miscellaneous, Industrial, Fire Protection-Standard, Fire Protection-Public, and Aquifer Storage and Recovery (ASR).
Status of well permit application. (See attached data dictionary for valid values)
[Optional] Local identifier, or common name of the Well (eg. MW-1).
Is the well a replacement well? (Yes/No)
Is well  terminus housed in a pit or vault? (Yes/No)
Is the intended use for the water from this well for potable consumption? (Yes/No)
Brand of pump to be used.
Minimum diameter of well, in inches (for most well min and max are same)
Feet below ground surface of the bottom of the gravel filter pack.
Water level when the well is not pumping, measured in feet below land surface.
Proposed method of drilling to create the well. (See attached data dictionary for valid values)
Material used to make up the filter pack. (See attached data dictionary for valid values)
Material that the well screen is made of (PVC, Stainless Steel, etc) (See attached data dictionary for valid values)
Major Drainage basin in which well is located (e.g. Delaware River, Chesapeake Bay, Atlantic Ocean)  (See attached data dictionary for valid values)
Reference number from DNREC's Online Permitting Application
Are there potential sources of contamination in the vicinity (1,000 feet of the well location)? (Yes/No)
This is a system generated field created from the Latitude and Longitude fields so that the data can be mapped.
Was this well replaced and retained for other uses. (Y or 1 = Yes. N or 0 = no)
Is there an existing well on the property? (Yes/No)
Does the well permit require additional review? (Yes/No)
Is the well in a confined aquifer? (Yes/No)
Was the well permit issued in response to an emergency situation? (Yes/No)
Is well located in a floodplain? (Yes/No)
Is well in an Agricultural Preservation District? (Yes/No)
Does the well require a water allocation permit? (Yes/No)

resource.name: Restaurant Inspection Violations
resource.description: This is a public use data file on Delaware restaurant inspections for the past two years.  It includes a list of restaurants with violations reported during the inspection of the establishment.  There may be more than one record for a specific restaurant for a specific inspection date.  Multiple records for the same restaurant and inspection date indicates multiple violations.
resource.attribution: Department of Health and Social Services, Division of Public Health, Office of Food Protection
columns_description: Restaurant Zip Code
Restaurant name
Date of restaurant inspection conducted by the Division of Public Health - Office of Food Protection

The violation code that this restaurant was cited for in this inspection. If no violation code is present, there were no violations for this inspection. There may be numerous violations that a restaurant is cited for in a single visit.  If this is the case, there will be multiple rows for this restaurant with the same inspection date.
Inspection visit type:  routine, follow-up, or complaint.
Street address, city, state and zip code for geolocation purposes
Description of the violation which corresponds to the violation code.
Restaurant street address
Restaurant city

resource.name: Student Assessment Performance
resource.description: This file contains the number of tested students, proficient students, and the corresponding proficiency rate for the key annual assessments administered during a given school year.
columns_description: Represents the race/ethnicity of the unique group of students within a school/district.

Indicates whether the aggregate data in this row has either been REDACTED or REPORTED. If redacted, certain data has been hidden to comply with state and federal privacy laws. For more information, contact the Delaware Department of Education.
The average scale score for the specified group of students.
Names the unique group of students within a school/district described by the combination of Race, Gender, Grade, SpecialDemo, and Geography.

Statewide summative assessment subject (or content area). Valid values include: CMP – EL Annual ACCESS Composite Score; ELA – English Language Arts/Reading; ESSAY – Essay Component of SAT assessment; MATH – Mathematics; SCI – Science; SOC – Social Studies;
Full name of the School District. Statewide data rows have "State of Delaware" in this column.
School year for which record is applicable.  For example, 2016 = school year which ended in June 2016.
Number representing each School District. Statewide data rows will have “0” in this column.
Full name of the Organization which is the School if School Code is given in the row. Districtwide data rows give full name of School District. Statewide rows give "State of Delaware" in this column.
The percent of students who earned an achievement level considered proficient. This is the number of students who earned a proficient achievement level divided by the number of students who tested.
The number of students who completed the statewide summative assessment listed with a valid score
The number of students who earned a proficient achievement level. This is typically considered as 3 or above.
Represents the special population status of the unique group of students within a school/district.
Represents the grade level of the unique group of students within a school/district.
Number representing each School within the school district. Statewide or Districtwide data rows will have “0” in this column.
Represents the grade level of the unique group of students within a school/district.
Represents the geography of the unique group of students within a school/district. Geography can have the following values:  ALL – all geographies combined

Statewide summative assessment name. Valid values include: ACCESS – EL Annual ACCESS assessment; DCAS – Delaware Comprehensive Assessment System; DCAS-Alt1 – Delaware Comprehensive Assessment System – Alternate Assessment; DeSSAALT – Delaware System; SAT11 – SAT assessment; SBAC – Smarter Balanced Assessment Consortium

resource.name: Disciplinary Actions for Professional and Occupational Licensees
resource.description: Any disciplinary action that has been taken by the State of Delaware against a professional or occupational licensee.
resource.attribution: Department of State, Division of Professional Regulation
columns_description: The end date of the disciplinary action.  If the disciplinary end date is blank, then the disciplinary action has not been completed.  Certain types of disciplinary actions will not have an end date, such as Letter of Reprimand and Revocation.
The license number issued by the State of Delaware for this individual and the specific professional/occupational license.
Type of disciplinary action taken against the licensee.
The start date of the disciplinary action.

resource.name: Current Contracts
resource.description: This dataset is updated weekly and provides a list of current contracts posted on Delaware Bids & Contracts.  All live up-to-date information should be accessed by using the Source Link listed on this page.
resource.attribution: Office of Management and Budget (OMB), Government Support Services (GSS)

Expiration date of contract
Effective date of contract
Lists related Multi Features
United Nations Standard Products and Services Code related to contract

Title of contract
Agency listed on contract
Y = Contract has available extensions
Y = Contract is listed in eMarketplace
This field is used to aid in the development of charts for this dataset. The value will always be “1” and is otherwise not pertinent to this record.

resource.name: Recently Closed Bids
resource.description: This dataset is updated weekly and provides a list of recently closed bids posted on Delaware Bids & Contracts for informational purposes. All live up-to-date information should be accessed by using the Source Link listed on this page.
resource.attribution: Office of Management and Budget (OMB), Government Support Services (GSS)

resource.name: Popular Baby Names in Delaware
resource.description: This is a public use data file on Delaware's most popular baby names for 2009 to 2016 obtained from the Delaware certificate of birth. The top 15 names for each gender are represented.
resource.attribution: Department of Health and Social Services, Division of Public Health, Delaware Health Statistics Center
columns_description: Baby name
Rank 1 is the most popular name of babies born during the specified year. Top 15 baby names
Gender
Year of birth

resource.name: Senate Districts
resource.description:
Redistricting after federal decennial census.

The apportionment provided for by this chapter shall continue in effect until the official reporting by the President of the United States of the next federal decennial census. Within 120 calendar days following the receipt, by the entity designated by the Governor, of the federal decennial census data for redistricting pursuant to Public Law 94-171, the General Assembly shall reapportion and redistrict the State, wherever necessary, for the general election of 2032 and thereafter in such a manner that the several representative and senatorial districts shall comply, insofar as possible, with the criteria set forth in § 804(1)-(4) of this title. Such apportionment shall thence continue in effect until the next succeeding federal decennial census.

resource.name: Student Discipline
resource.description: This file contains the number of students who have received at least one disciplinary action of in-school suspension, out-of-school suspension, or expulsion within a given school year. The file also contains the number of students enrolled and the corresponding percentage of students who received a disciplinary action.
columns_description: The percent of students receiving the disciplinary action. This is the number disciplined students divided by the number of enrolled students.
The number of students in the enrolled in the specified organization.
The category of disciplinary action used.
Names the unique group of students within a school/district described by the combination of Race, Gender, Grade, SpecialDemo, and Geography.
Represents the special population status of the unique group of students within a school/district.
Full name of the School District. Statewide data rows have "State of Delaware" in this column.
Number representing each School District. Statewide data rows will have “0” in this column.
School year for which record is applicable.  For example, 2016 = school year which ended in June 2016.
The total number of incidents that resulted in the specified disciplinary action for the specified student demographic
The average numbers of days of the specified disciplinary action for the specified student demographic
The number of students in the specified subgroup who received the disciplinary action
Represents the gender of the unique group of students within a school/district.

Indicates whether the aggregate data in this row has either been REDACTED or REPORTED. If redacted, certain data has been hidden to comply with state and federal privacy laws. For more information, contact the Delaware Department of Education.
Represents the geography of the unique group of students within a school/district.
Represents the grade level of the unique group of students within a school/district.
Represents the race/ethnicity of the unique group of students within a school/district.
Full name of the Organization which is the School if School Code is given in the row. Districtwide data rows give full name of School District. Statewide rows give "State of Delaware" in this column.
Number representing each School within the school district. Statewide or Districtwide data rows will have “0” in this column.

resource.name: Rock Deployment
resource.description: Artificial reef programs site, manage and develop reefs, but also have the responsibility to communicate the locations of reef material placements to anglers in order to facilitate enhanced fishing opportunities, one of the major goals of the effort. Because angler and boater funds (excise taxes) are primarily used for reef development, it is important to communicate this information to anglers and it is part of the federal aid project.
columns_description: Longitude location of deployed material.
Site Location number of the Artificial Reef
Geometry
Site Location number of deployed materials.
Depth of deployed materal.
Latitude location of deployed material.
